newsitem.title: UK: Major says Britain much better off in Europe.
newsitem.headline: Major says Britain much better off in Europe.

text.p: British Prime Minister John Major said on Friday that Britain was "infinitely better off" as part of Europe but said he was seeking a more flexible Europe.
"We are infinitely better off being in the European Union," Major said on BBC Television. "That is beyond doubt for trading relationships and wider issues as well."
But he said not all of the goals of Britain's EU partners were palatable to him.
"(Greater centralisation) is not right for us and is unpalatable to our instincts," Major said. "We do not favour a federalist, centralist Europe and we must seek a more flexible Europe."
"We must negotiate much more flexibility in the European summit at Amsterdam next year and the period of negotiations between now and Amsterdam.
